name: io.github.rosch100/mcp-encrypted-sqlite
description: MCP server for encrypted SQLite databases (SQLCipher 4) - Works with MoneyMoney, KeePass and more

environmentVariables.description: Path to the encrypted SQLite database file (inside container: /data/database.sqlite)
environmentVariables.name: DB_PATH

environmentVariables.description: Passphrase for decrypting the database (or use encrypted: prefix for encrypted passphrases)
environmentVariables.name: DB_PASSPHRASE

installation.instructions:
## Quick Start with Docker

1. Pull the Docker image:
   docker pull ghcr.io/rosch100/mcp-encrypted-sqlite:latest

2. Add to your Cursor MCP configuration file (~/.cursor/mcp.json):
   Use the configuration template provided in the Configuration section.
   Replace /path/to/your/database.sqlite with your database path.
   Replace your-passphrase with your database passphrase.

3. Restart Cursor and verify in Settings -> MCP that the server is running.

## Usage Examples

Ask Cursor AI:
- List all tables in my database
- Show me the schema of the accounts table
- Query the last 10 transactions

## From Source (Alternative)

   git clone https://github.com/rosch100/mcp-encrypted-sqlite.git
   cd mcp-encrypted-sqlite
   ./gradlew installDist

For detailed installation instructions, see the README.md file in the repository.
